Career Profile

For over 15 years, I have worked in the games industry as an Engineer and a Technical Artist on PC, console and mobile game titles

During the course of my career, I have worked primarily on graphics as well as tools and workflow for game engine editors and DCC art production programs.

I am very passionate about real-time 3D graphics, production tools and have a strong interest in dev-ops, automation, AI and machine learning.

Career Objective

I want to permanently work long-term for a well established and successful game company.

I am strongly interested in obtaining a senior or mid-level position as an Engineer or a Technical Artist.

I wish to contribute my knowledge and skills to efficiently make engaging, high quality game experiences.

Career Relocation

I am open to relocating to international locations for my career.

Education

2D & 3D
Video Game Programming
(Foundation Year)

1997/09 ~ 1998/04
Digipen
Vancouver, Canada

I attended the game development school Digipen in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.

While there, I routinely studied technology, complex algorithms, mathematics and programming.

Together with a small group of students, I learned to work as a team to create a game project.

As the school intended to migrate to the United States, I decided to continue my studies independently.

Rendering Optimizations - Customized Mesh Baker source to compress animated models and reduce draw calls
